full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 459 Filed 11/15/21 Page 30 of 43
LalWmaxC
1 lines.
2 (Persistent feedback)
3 THE COURT: I think we've muted everyone.
4 Ms. Williams, can you indicate by text whether you can hear me.
5 hear me.
6 OK. And now I'll ask, Ms. Pomerantz, are you able to speak now?
7
8 MS. POMERANTZ: Yes, your Honor.
9 THE COURT: All right. I think we've done that so I'm going to have Ms. Williams please keep everyone muted until I call on them. That seems, hopefully, to be able to resolve the issue.
12
13 Go ahead, Ms. Pomerantz.
14 MS. POMERANTZ: Thank you, your Honor.
15 The government is not aware of any reason why Audrey Strauss's name would come up at trial, so the government doesn't understand the basis for the inclusion.
18 THE COURT: All right.
19 I'll ask for Ms. Sternheim to be unmuted, please, and then mute Ms. Pomerantz while --
21 Go ahead, Ms. Sternheim.
22 MS. STERNHEIM: I am unmuted. And Judge, I just want you to know I have not moved my phone, so I do not think that I contributed to the problem before.
25 THE COURT: OK.
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00007002
